definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: With all the variety and adventure, Able Seaman Green said she enjoyed her work.
sentences.chinese: 面对变化和冒险，二等兵格林说她非常喜欢她的工作。

sentences.english: The very major problem that Chinese mathematics faces is lack of leadership.
sentences.chinese: 当今中国数学界面对的大难，便是缺乏领导者。

sentences.english: L/C Payment problem is becoming serious to each bank.
sentences.chinese: 信用证垫款问题是各银行面对的日趋严重的一个问题。

sentences.english: True extremely not easily Huan Yao brave the life disturbances facing.
sentences.chinese: 人生的风风雨雨真的很不容易还要勇敢的面对。

sentences.english: The Chinese people faced this disaster with compassion and courage.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民用爱心和勇气来面对这场灾难。

sentences.english: Don't push the face down, but use the body to drive the head forward.
sentences.chinese: 别推下来，但使用面对身体来驱动头向前。

sentences.english: The reward for facing fear is that you get to be fully alive.
sentences.chinese: 面对恐惧的奖励就是你变得完全的鲜活了。

sentences.english: Face the light or lurk in darkness.
sentences.chinese: 面对光明，或藏伏在黑暗里。

sentences.english: They've never been able to come to grips with the fact they're bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 他们永远也无法面对自己是破产者的事实。

sentences.english: As a pastor I face this all the time.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个牧师我一直面对着这种状况。

sentences.english: She admits that her life is not a fairy tale and that she faces many challenges.
sentences.chinese: 她坦承她的生活并非童话般轻松，而要面对很多挑战。

sentences.english: As a matter of fact, the enterprise-oriented social partnership is held back by various factors.
sentences.chinese: 其实，以企业为主导的社会伙伴关系面对种种的限制。

sentences.english: And God says sooner or later you will have to face the consequences of your sin.
sentences.chinese: 神说或早或晚你都要面对罪的后果。

sentences.english: Love really need courage to face the tattle and prate.
sentences.chinese: 爱真的需要勇气，来面对流言蜚语。

sentences.english: At present, food safety has become the global problem.
sentences.chinese: 当前，食品安全已成为全球面对的难题。

sentences.english: Without the torment of the night's untruth.
sentences.chinese: 而不需面对夜晚虚伪的折磨。

definition: to face sth/to be confronted with
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to meet/to run into/to come across
